title: PHYS 305 Introduction to Biophysics
description: Physical principles involved in biological systems at the microscopic and molecular scales. Diffusion, low Reynolds number dynamics, the physicist's view of biomolecular structure, models of molecular motors and membranes.
prerequisites: One of PHYS 102, PHYS 108, PHYS 153, SCIE 001 and either (a) one of PHYS 203, PHYS 313 or (b) one of ENPH 257, PHYS 257, CHEM 201, CHEM 205 and one of MATH 302, MATH 318, STAT 241, STAT 251, STAT 302.
